Class mp_DistributionConditionalTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.mp_DistributionConditionalTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    mp_i_DistributionConditional, mp_i_DistributionConditionalTable

    public class mp_DistributionConditionalTable
extends Object
implements mp_i_DistributionConditionalTable
    Default implementation of the ConditionalProbabilityTable interface.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly

      • getFor

        public Set<mp_i_RandomVariable> getFor()
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        A convenience method for merging the elements of getParents() and getOn() into a consistent ordered set (i.e. getOn() should always be the last Random Variable returned when iterating over the set).
        Specified by:
        getFor in interface mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Returns:
        a consistent ordered Set (e.g. LinkedHashSet) of the random variables this conditional probability distribution is for.

      • getValue

        public double getValue(Object... eventValues)
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Get the value for the provided set of values for the random variables comprising the Conditional Distribution (ordering and size of each must equal getFor() and their domains must match).
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Parameters:
        eventValues - the values for the random variables comprising the Conditional Distribution
        Returns:
        the value for the possible worlds associated with the assignments for the random variables comprising the Conditional Distribution.

        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Get the value for the provided set of AssignmentPropositions for the random variables comprising the Conditional Distribution (size of each must equal and their random variables must match).

        Returns:

      • getSample

        public Object getSample(double probabilityChoice,
               Object... parentValues)
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Retrieve a specific example for the Random Variable this conditional distribution is on.
        Specified by:
        getSample in interface mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Parameters:
        probabilityChoice - a double value, from the range [0.0d, 1.0d), i.e. 0.0d (inclusive) to 1.0d (exclusive).
        parentValues - for the conditioning case. The ordering and size of parentValues must equal getParents() and their domains must match.
        Returns:
        a sample value from the domain of the Random Variable this distribution is on, based on the probability argument passed in.
        See Also:
        mp_i_DistributionConditional.getOn()

      • getSample

        public Object getSample(double probabilityChoice,
               mp_PropositionTermOpsAssignment... parentValues)
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Retrieve a specific example for the Random Variable this conditional distribution is on.
        Specified by:
        getSample in interface mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Parameters:
        probabilityChoice - a double value, from the range [0.0d, 1.0d), i.e. 0.0d (inclusive) to 1.0d (exclusive).
        parentValues - for the conditioning case. The size of parentValues must equal getParents() and their Random Variables must match.
        Returns:
        a sample value from the domain of the Random Variable this distribution is on, based on the probability argument passed in.
        See Also:
        mp_i_DistributionConditional.getOn()

      • getConditioningCase

        public mp_i_CategoricalDistributionIterator getConditioningCase(Object... parentValues)
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        A conditioning case is just a possible combination of values for the parent nodes - a miniature possible world, if you like. The returned distribution must sum to 1, because the entries represent an exhaustive set of cases for the random variable.
        Specified by:
        getConditioningCase in interface mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Specified by:
        getConditioningCase in interface mp_i_DistributionConditionalTable
        Parameters:
        parentValues - for the conditioning case. The ordering and size of parentValues must equal getParents() and their domains must match.
        Returns:
        the Probability Distribution for the Random Variable the Conditional Probability Distribution is On.
        See Also:
        mp_i_DistributionConditional.getOn(), mp_i_DistributionConditional.getParents()

      • getConditioningCase

        public mp_i_CategoricalDistributionIterator getConditioningCase(mp_PropositionTermOpsAssignment... parentValues)
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditional
        A conditioning case is just a possible combination of values for the parent nodes - a miniature possible world, if you like. The returned distribution must sum to 1, because the entries represent an exhaustive set of cases for the random variable.
        Specified by:
        getConditioningCase in interface mp_i_DistributionConditional
        Specified by:
        getConditioningCase in interface mp_i_DistributionConditionalTable
        Parameters:
        parentValues - for the conditioning case. The size of parentValues must equal getParents() and their Random Variables must match.
        Returns:
        the Probability Distribution for the Random Variable the Conditional Probability Distribution is On.
        See Also:
        mp_i_DistributionConditional.getOn(), mp_i_DistributionConditional.getParents()

      • getFactorFor

        public mp_Factor getFactorFor(mp_PropositionTermOpsAssignment... evidence)
        Description copied from interface: mp_i_DistributionConditionalTable
        Construct a Factor consisting of the Random Variables from the Conditional Probability Table that are not part of the evidence (see AIMA3e pg. 524).
        Specified by:
        getFactorFor in interface mp_i_DistributionConditionalTable
        Returns:
        a Factor for the Random Variables from the Conditional Probability Table that are not part of the evidence.
